extracted_rules.rule: General Standards for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulations for accessory structures that are not second-dwelling units.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to all non-dwelling accessory structures on a residential lot.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Second-dwelling units are excluded from these rules.

Variables.dimensional: Structure size (sf); Distance from main dwelling

Conditions.mandatory: Use must be incidental to the main dwelling; Must be detached from the main dwelling; Must be at least 3 feet from the main dwelling; May NOT have a kitchen; Counts toward the total lot coverage.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF the structure is over 120 sf, THEN a building permit is required AND it counts towards the total gross floor area.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: Accessory structures less than 120 sf do not require a building permit, but must still comply with all other zoning regulations.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is a base rule set that applies to all non-dwelling accessory structures. It is supplemented by location-specific rules.
Relationships.cross-references: Code Section 18.12.080 (Page 30-31); Code Section 18.12.080 (b) (4) (Page 32); Relates to 'total lot coverage' and 'total gross floor area' calculations.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Compliance with these general rules is a prerequisite for applying location-specific rules. The term 'incidental to main dwelling' is ambiguous and requires a formal definition for automated validation.

extracted_rules.rule: Standards for Accessory Structures in the Buildable Area

Qualifiers.Scope: Height and daylight plane regulations for accessory structures.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies only to non-dwelling accessory structures located within the 'buildable area' of a lot.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Accessory structures located in the required setback.

Constants.specs: Regulations are inherited from the main dwelling; no specific constants provided on this page.

Conditions.mandatory: The structure is subject to the same height and daylight plane regulations as the main dwelling.
Conditions.dependencies: Depends on the height and daylight plane regulations defined for the 'main dwelling'.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is a specific rule set that applies in addition to the 'General Standards for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures'.
Relationships.cross-references: Implicitly references regulations for the 'main dwelling'.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Application requires the definition of 'buildable area'. The specific regulations for 'main dwelling' height and daylight plane are not provided on this page and must be referenced from another source.

extracted_rules.rule: Standards for Accessory Structures in the Required Setback

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulations for accessory structures located within the required setback area of a lot.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies only to non-dwelling accessory structures located in the 'required setback' area.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Location in the front yard; Location in the street-side yard; Location in the rear yard of a through lot.

Variables.dimensional: Rear yard coverage percentage; Structure size (sf); Height; Daylight plane
Variables.usage: Use for sleeping or living; Presence of a kitchen

Conditions.mandatory: May not be located in the front yard; May not be located in the street-side yard; May not be located in the rear yard of a through lot; May not cover more than 50% of the rear yard; May not be used for sleeping or living; May NOT have a kitchen; Counts toward the total lot coverage; Subject to the accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations.
Conditions.conditional_logic: IF structure is over 120 sf, THEN a building permit is required AND it counts towards total gross floor area; IF structure is over 200 sf, THEN it may have no more than two plumbing fixtures.

Exceptions.explicit_deviations: Accessory structures less than 120 sf do not require a building permit, but must still comply with all other zoning regulations.

Relationships.hierarchical: This is a specific rule set that applies in addition to the 'General Standards for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures'.
Relationships.cross-references: Refers to 'accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations (see Figs 25-26 on p. 32)'; Relates to 'total lot coverage' and 'total gross floor area' calculations.
Relationships.logical_dependencies: Application requires definitions of 'required setback', 'front yard', 'street-side yard', 'rear yard', and 'through lot'. The specific regulations for 'accessory-structure height and daylight plane' are on another page (p. 32) and must be referenced.
